bibl.title: Letter from B.R. Newton to Henry Rose Carter, December 9, 1915

div1.p: Newton approves the employment of assistants for malaria field work.

div1.head: Letter from B.R. Newton to Henry Rose Carter, December 9, 1915
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
ASSISTANT SECRETARY
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
WASHINGTON
December 9, 1915.
The Medical Officer in Charge,
Public Health Service,
Field Investigations of Malaria.
Sir:
div1.p:
By direction of the Secretary, and as recommended by the
Surgeon-General in his endorsement upon your communication of
the 7th instant, the employment of the following named persons
as Attendants in the Public Health Service, in connection with
field investigations of Malaria, with compensation at the rate
of Two Dollars and Fifty Cents ($2.50) per diem each, is here-
by approved, for the periods and from the dates set opposite
their named:

E. A. Hall (reemployment), four days, beginning October 27,
1915

W. D. Campbell (reemployment), two days, beginning October
27, 1915
div1.closer:
Respectfully, B R Newton
Assistant Secretary. ✓
